intro: Freycinetia hydra subsp. apodistigma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed freycinetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pandanaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or lowland forest areas. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced bract structures and specific leaf morphology compared to other subspecies of Freycinetia hydra.
